main.java.de.bsi.tsesimulator.tse.storage

Class PersistedValues

  • java.lang.Object
    • main.java.de.bsi.tsesimulator.tse.storage.PersistedValues
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class PersistedValues
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Used to save all data that is not a log message or belongs to user management via the Java Serialization. Is used by the PersistentStorage to store and load the saved values into the TSE.
    Since:
    1.0
    Version:
    1.5
    Author:
    dpottkaemper
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • PersistedValues

        private PersistedValues()
        private constructor for the sake of only persisting complete sets of values

      • PersistedValues

        public PersistedValues(long clockStatus,
                       boolean initialized,
                       boolean disabled,
                       long signatureCounterStatus,
                       long transactionNumberStatus,
                       java.lang.String descriptionOfTheSEAPI)
        Constructor which stores all relevant data in the instance variables.
        Parameters:
        clockStatus - the time of the clock inside the CryptoCore at the time of the method call. The time has to be a long in unix time.
        initialized - the initialization status of the TSE. True if it has been initialized.
        disabled - the state of the SE API, false if the SE API has not been disabled.
        signatureCounterStatus - the signature counter in the CryptoCore at the time of the method call.
        transactionNumberStatus - the transaction counter of the ERSSpecificModule at the time of the method call.
        Since:
        1.0
